3/20/2024.name: Family Action Network presents: Over the Influence: Why Social Media is Toxic for Women and Girls
3/20/2024.description:
In Over the Influence: Why Social Media is Toxic for Women and Girls - And How We Can Take It Back, communication professor and CNN Opinion contributor Kara Alaimo, Ph.D. reveals how social media is affecting every aspect of the lives of women, girls, and nonbinary people -from our relationships and our parenting to our physical and mental wellbeing. Over the Influence is a book about what it means to live in the world social media has wrought - whether you're constantly connected or have deleted your accounts forever. Alaimo shows why you're likely to get fewer followers if you're a woman. She demonstrates how fake news is crafted to prey on women's vulnerabilities. She reveals why so much of the content we find in our feeds is specifically designed to hold us back. And she explains how social media has made the offline world an uglier place for women. Alaimo offers up brilliant advice for how to get over the influence-how to handle our daughters' use of social media, use dating apps to find who we're looking for, use social networks to bolster our careers, and protect ourselves from sextortionists, catfishers, and trolls. She also explains what we need to demand from lawmakers and tech companies to solve these problems.
 













 Links  * Event Page:  https://www.familyactionnetwork.net/events/over-th... 



  




* Register via Zoom:  https://us02web.zoom.us/webinar/register/191708034...

4/2/2024.name: Family Action Network presents: Supercommunicators: How to Unlock the Secret Language of Connection
4/2/2024.description:
Charles Duhigg, the author of The Power of Habit and Smarter Faster Better, launches yet another New York Times bestseller: Supercommunicators: How to Unlock the Secret Language of Connection, a fascinating exploration of what makes conversations work-and how we can all learn to be supercommunicators at work and in life. Communication is a superpower and the best communicators understand that whenever we speak, we're actually participating in one of three conversations: practical (What's this really about?), emotional (How do we feel?), and social (Who are we?). If you don't know what kind of conversation you're having, you're unlikely to connect. Supercommunicators know the importance of recognizing-and then matching-each kind of conversation, and how to hear the complex emotions, subtle negotiations, and deeply held beliefs that color so much of what we say and how we listen. Our experiences, our values, our emotional lives-and how we see ourselves, and others-shape every discussion, from who will pick up the kids to how we want to be treated at work.


 













 Links  * Event Page:  https://www.familyactionnetwork.net/events/superco...
4/2/2024.location: New Trier High School | New Trier Township, IL

4/3/2024.name: CCC Presents: Freshmen Family Night
4/3/2024.description:
The College Career Center will hold its annual night for freshmen families at 7 p.m. on Wednesday, April 3rd. The event will be in person in the PAC but can also be streamed live via Zoom:  https://zoom.us/j/95868172181 .

The slides and recording for this presentation will be available on the CCC website within one week of the event for families unable to attend.

Post Secondary Counselors Ms. Sara English and Mr. Dan Miller, Counselor Mrs. Jorie Dwyer, and Career Exploration Program Manager Ms. Travis will discuss what students can expect during the next three years as they journey toward post-high school opportunities. Students are strongly encouraged to attend with their parent(s) or guardian(s).

 Families that would like   to request a copy of the slide deck in another language can reach out to    shs_CollegeCareer@d125.org   , or via phone at (847) 415-4517 prior to Friday, March 22nd.

4/8/2024.name: Family Action Network presents: The Menopause Brain
4/8/2024.description:
Menopause and perimenopause are still a black box to most doctors, leaving patients exasperated as they grapple with symptoms ranging from hot flashes to insomnia to brain fog. In her new book, The Menopause Brain, leading neuroscientist and women's brain health specialist Lisa Mosconi, Ph.D. unravels these mysteries by revealing how menopause doesn't just impact the ovaries-it's a hormonal show in which the brain takes center stage. The decline of the hormone estrogen during menopause influences everything from body temperature to mood to memory, potentially paving the way for cognitive decline later in life. To conquer these challenges successfully, Dr. Mosconi brings us the latest approaches-explaining the role of cutting-edge hormone replacement therapies like "designer estrogens," hormonal contraception, and key lifestyle changes encompassing diet, exercise, self-care, and self-talk. Best of all, Dr. Mosconi dispels the myth that menopause signifies an end, demonstrating that it is a transition




 













 Links  * Register via Zoom:  https://us02web.zoom.us/webinar/register/161710340... 


* Event Page:  https://www.familyactionnetwork.net/events/the-men...

4/13/2024.name: CCC Features: College of Lake County Open House
4/13/2024.description:
This event promises to be a wonderful opportunity for students to gain insights into the array of educational offerings available at CLC. Participants have the chance to explore our five locations, learn about our diverse degree and career certificate programs, and interact with our expert faculty, staff, and students. Additionally, the Open House will feature several engaging activities, including free financial aid workshops, a showcase at the Maker Faire, and a tour of the new Prairie Restaurant at Brae Loch, managed by CLC's talented hospitality and culinary students.
 

 Students can learn how to get a jump on a four-year degree, start a new career, boost their resume or enrich their life, they'll want to attend the CLC community open house. It's fun, free and a low-stress way to meet our expert faculty and caring staff, explore 170+ degree and certificate programs covering nine areas of study, learn about resources and support - including financial aid, grants, scholarships and apprenticeships and check out our student clubs, sports and organizations.
 

 For more details about the event and to register, please see the links below:
 *  Event link:   https://www.clcillinois.edu/news-and-events/events/open-house 
*    Registration link:   https://clcadmissions.my.salesforce-sites.com/events/targetX_eventsb__events#/esr?eid=a0lHp00002MsT6cIAF
4/13/2024.location: College of Lake County | Grayslake, Lakeshore & Southlake Campuses, Advanced Technology Center, and Prairie Restaurant at Brae Loch

4/15/2024.name: Family Action Network presents: Belonging: The Science of Creating Connection and Bridging Divides
4/15/2024.description:
We live in enormously divisive times. Divisions based on class, politics, race, religion, gender, and nationality are erupting around the globe. The consequences of not having a sense of belonging range from political strife to illness to underperformance at work and in the classroom. Americans have become disconnected from their communities, and about one in five Americans suffers from chronic loneliness, especially young adults. Why is our sense of belonging so undermined? What if there were a set of science-backed techniques for navigating modern social life that could help us overcome our differences, create empathy, and forge lasting connections across divides?
 Links  * Event Page:  https://www.familyactionnetwork.net/events/belongi...
4/15/2024.location: Stevenson High School | The Little Theatre (Room 4200)

There is a $5 door fee with all proceeds benefiting Models of Diversity. At Models of Diversity their purpose is to promote greater diversity in the fashion, beauty, and media industries. 4/23/2024.name: Freshmen Wellness Day
4/23/2024.description:
While all the sophomores are taking their PSATs, all freshmen will spend a fun-filled day with SHS staff to explore the theme of "Live in Community!" Through a variety of activities, freshmen will grow their skills to:
 * Build character and a sense of confidence while appreciating the similarities and differences of others.
* Listen to others and communicate in ways that build empathy and respect.
* Understand what it means to be an effective ally when people are treated with disrespect or injustice.
* Establish and maintain supportive relationships in ways that foster learning.
 
Things to remember:
 * Students should bring their SHS ID and their fully-charged iPad.
* Bus service to and from school will be provided. Buses will arrive at school at the regularly-scheduled time. Buses will depart from SHS at 12:45 pm.
* The cafeteria will be open to students before the program begins as it would on a "regular" school day. A light snack will be provided during the day. Students may want to consider bringing a water bottle and packing additional snacks for the day. Lunch service will not be provided on this day.
4/23/2024.location: Stevenson High School | Patriot Wellness Center

4/23/2024.name: Family Action Network presents: Somehow: Thoughts on Love
4/23/2024.description:
In Somehow: Thoughts on Love, beloved bestselling author Anne Lamott explores the transformative power that love has in our lives: how it surprises us, forces us to confront uncomfortable truths, reminds us of our humanity, and guides us forward. "Love just won't be pinned down," she says. "It is in our very atmosphere" and lies at the heart of who we are. We are, Lamott says, creatures of love. In each chapter of Somehow, Lamott refracts all the colors of the spectrum. She explores the unexpected love for a partner later in life. The bruised (and bruising) love for a child who disappoints, even frightens. The sustaining love among a group of sinners, for a community in transition, in the wider world. The lessons she underscores are that love enlightens as it educates, comforts as it energizes, sustains as it surprises.
 













 Links  * Event Page:  https://www.familyactionnetwork.net/events/somehow...
4/23/2024.location: Loyola Academy, McGrath Family Performing Arts Center | Wilmette, IL

4/27/2024.name: SASA Show
4/27/2024.description:
Are you interested in mouth-watering cultural cuisine? Are you ready to be mesmerized by cultural performances that make you want to stand up and start dancing? Join the South Asian Student Association for their final event of the school year: the SASA Show!

The show will take place on Saturday, April 27 from 12-2 p.m. in the Recital Hall, entrance will be from the PWC. In addition to the enlightening trivia, music, and traditional games, don't miss the chance to participate in the dance competition for a chance to win a gift card! The competition will consist of performances where all registered teams will be judged by how well they represent South Asian Culture through the quality of their performances.

Be sure to sign up and pay the entrance fee on the GoFan app by Friday, April 26. The event is $5 per person. Friends and families are welcome!

 PURCHASE: Tickets via GoFan

4/30/2024.name: Consortium Art Festival
4/30/2024.description:
The Consortium ArtFest celebrates the artistic work of our Consortium K-8 and Adlai E. Stevenson High School students. This collaborative event is a favorite among our communities.

Parents, guardians, families, students, and friends are cordially invited to attend the 44th Consortium ArtFest Evening Reception on Tues. April 30, 2024, between 5:00 - 8:00 p.m. at Stevenson High School's Field House. Parking and entrance details are included on the map on the back page of this invitation.

The Consortium ArtFest Evening Reception is an open-house event. Come anytime between 5:00 - 8:00 p.m. During this window of time, the Consortium Art teachers will pass out certificates to each participating student. Light refreshments will be served throughout the event and the following activities will be part of the celebration.

Other activities include:
 * Empty Bowls Project Fundraiser (Bowls are $5 each and proceeds go to the Vernon Township Food Pantry)
* Ceramic Wheel Demonstrations
* Coloring, Painting, and Button Making

5/2/2024.name: Senior Sunrise
5/2/2024.description: Celebrate new beginnings on Friday at the Senior Sunrise! The event will be held from 7:30 a.m. to 8:25 a.m. in the Stadium. If you're attending college, feel free to wear your school gear. There will be hot chocolate, orange juice, fruit, donuts & bagels and cream cheese, other food, and music. You can also pick up your cap and gown for graduation! Students should bring their ID to be able to pick up their caps and gowns. There will also be the opportunity for you to get your own autograph toy and have all of your friends sign it! Ultimately, it will be a great time to hang out with your friends and remember good times from high school at Stevenson!

5/3/2024.name: 2024 Spring Dance Concert
5/3/2024.description:
The Spring Dance Concert consists of student choreography from the Mélange and Repertory Dance Companies, the Concert Dance Class, and usually a guest artist. All dances are chosen via an audition process. Choreographers develop the concept and cast the dancers for their pieces under the mentorship of their directors. Featuring the Mélange and Repertory Dance Companies and the Concert Dance Class.

 Links 


 *  PURCHASE: Tickets via GoFan   
* Event Program --  coming soon!
5/3/2024.location: Stevenson High School | Performing Arts Center

5/3/2024.name: One Acts 2024
5/3/2024.description:
The Patriot Theatre Company proudly presents our annual evening of student-written and student-produced One Acts. Though these six short plays were born from mere whiffs of inspiration over the last year, they represent a lifetime of lived experiences. They were nurtured in workshops through our Scripts Studio club, drafted countless times, and finally selected from over 20 works submitted early December. Then, the real work began to refine their story to create highly engaging experiences for the audience. These plays offer a mirror to our present complicated world and a window into what is possible when students are given the leeway to create and collaborate with their peers. These plays are hilarious, touching, and above all else-honest depictions of what it means to really see the world through fresh and talented eyes. We look forward to you joining us!



 Links 
 *  PURCHASE: Tickets via GoFan 
* Event Program --  coming soon!
